newsitem.title: FRANCE: Eurocopter sees 96 turnover at around 9.3 bln Ffr.
newsitem.headline: Eurocopter sees 96 turnover at around 9.3 bln Ffr.

text.p: Franco-German helicopter maker Eurocopter forecast on Wednesday a 1996 turnover of around 9.3 billion francs, unchanged from 1995.

"As in 1995, turnover will be of the order of 9.3 billion francs. This figure includes customer support operations, research and development and deliveries of 165 new machines," the company said in a statement.
In 1996 Eurocopter and its subsidiaries received orders for 228 new helicopters.
Orders logged for both new and second-hand machines, research and development, customer services and sundry operations accounted for about 12 billion francs, up seven percent on 1995.
Eurocopter also said prospects for 1997 were encouraging with orders booked roughly of the order of 1996.
